title: Keep on cruising : Royal Caribbean expects double - digit profit growth
description: ‘2025 was an outstanding year, and the momentum is further accelerating into 2026,’ company’s CEO said
content:
## Stay up to date with notifications from The Independent

Notifications can be managed in browser preferences.

Not nowYes please

Swipe for next article

[Royal Caribbean](https://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/royal-carribbean-suspends-labadee-haiti-trips-b2901924.html) posted higher than expected earnings last year and now expects “double digit” growth in 2026 as demand for [vacations on the seas](https://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/cruise-ship-holidays-travel-trends-b2910074.html) soars.

The Miami-based [cruise company](https://www.independent.co.uk/travel/cruise/cruise-ship-health-gastro-norovirus-b2907773.html) reported earnings per share of $15.61 in 2025, outstripping expectations due to strong revenue and high-performing joint ventures, according to a company [news release](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/royal-caribbean-group-reports-2025-results-issues-2026-guidance-302673898.html) published on Thursday.

"2025 was an outstanding year, and the momentum is further accelerating into 2026," Jason Liberty, the chairman and CEO of the Royal Caribbean Group, said.

“We expect another strong year of financial performance with both revenue and earnings growing double digits,” he added.

Beyond gaining new customers, Royal Caribbean reported increased loyalty from repeat cruisers and said it intends to deploy two new vessels starting in 2029, while planning for four additional ones in the future.

![Royal Caribbean 'expects double-digit' revenue growth this year as demand increases, the company said](https://static.independent.co.uk/2026/01/30/3/34/GettyImages-2161029164.jpeg)

open image in gallery

Royal Caribbean 'expects double-digit' revenue growth this year as demand increases, the company said(AFP via Getty Images)

Following the announcement, [shares of the firm](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2026-01-29/royal-caribbean-jumps-as-accelerating-demand-spurs-fleet-growth) — one of the largest cruise companies
